newsitem.title: ESTONIA: ESTONIA-EMEX'S 1996 PROFIT 18.7 MLN KROONS - REPORT.
newsitem.headline: ESTONIA-EMEX'S 1996 PROFIT 18.7 MLN KROONS - REPORT.

text.p: The Estonian Metal Export Company (EMEX), made a 1996 profit of 18.7 million kroons and expects a 24 million kroon profit in 1997, the Aripaev business newspaper said on Friday.

The annual general shareholders' meeting, held on Thursday, decided to distribute 9.99 million kroons of the profit to the company's reserve, 4.93 million kroons will remain undistributed, and 3.75 million kroons will be paid out as dividends, the paper said.
The dividends will be paid to shareholders no later than July 31, the newspaper added.
The company is 95 percent owned by the state with the remaining five percent of shares divided between 862 shareholders.
The company invested 60 million kroons in new machinery in 1996.

The privatisation agency is to sell 51 percent of the company to a core investor and the remaining 44 percent will be sold for privatisation vouchers, Toomas Keridon, Chief Executive of EMEX, was quoted as saying by Aripaev.
